Line 105: Line 105:
===PWN 2 OWN browser exploit===
===PWN 2 OWN browser exploit===
â
In the PWN 2 OWN contest at the 2008 CanSecWest security conference in Vancouver, British Columbia, an exploit in Safari caused Mac OS X to be the first to fall in a hacking competition. Participants competed to find a way to read the contents of a file located on the user's desktop, in one of three operating systems — Mac OS X Leopard, Windows Vista SP1, and [[Ubuntu|Ubuntu 7.10]]. On the second day of the contest, when users were allowed to physically interact with the computers (the prior day permitted only network attacks), [[Charlie Miller (security researcher)|Charlie Miller]] compromised Mac OS X within two minutes, through an unpatched vulnerability of the [[Perl Compatible Regular Expressions|PCRE library]] used by Safari.<ref>{{cite news |first=Robert |last=McMillan |title=Mac hack contest bug had been public for a year |url=http://www.networkworld.com/news/2008/042208-mac-hack-contest-bug-had.html |work=[[Network World]] |publisher=[[IDG]] |date=2008-04-22 |accessdate=2008-06-12}}</ref><ref>The Windows Vista system was compromised on the third and final day of the contest. The Ubuntu Linux system was not successfully breached at all.</ref>
+
In the PWN 2 OWN contest at the 2008 CanSecWest security conference in Vancouver, British Columbia, an exploit in Safari caused Mac OS X to be the first to fall in a hacking competition. Participants competed to find a way to read the contents of a file located on the user's desktop, in one of three operating systems — Mac OS X Leopard, Windows Vista SP1, and [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu 7.10]]. On the second day of the contest, when users were allowed to physically interact with the computers (the prior day permitted only network attacks), [[Charlie Miller (security researcher)|Charlie Miller]] compromised Mac OS X within two minutes, through an unpatched vulnerability of the [[Perl Compatible Regular Expressions|PCRE library]] used by Safari.<ref>{{cite news |first=Robert |last=McMillan |title=Mac hack contest bug had been public for a year |url=http://www.networkworld.com/news/2008/042208-mac-hack-contest-bug-had.html |work=[[Network World]] |publisher=[[IDG]] |date=2008-04-22 |accessdate=2008-06-12}}</ref><ref>The Windows Vista system was compromised on the third and final day of the contest. The Ubuntu Linux system was not successfully breached at all.</ref>
===PWN 2 OWN browser exploit Two===
